result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlon R Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 07/24/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3: Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any domestic abuse surcharge, except mandatory surcharges. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 3: 
- Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.
- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment as able.
- Obtain GED/HSED.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 1, AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3; but Concurrent with each other

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon R Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  rmm

Defendant Marlon R Harris in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marlon R Harris in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Marlon R Harris in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1,2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive to Count 1, concurrent with Count 3 in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months consecutive to Count 1, concurrent with Count 2 in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 7/24/15.
-Supervision by the Mental Health Unit.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Due to financial hardship, Court waived all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any domestic abuse surcharge, except mandatory surcharges.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment as able.
-Obtain GED/HSED.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Marlon R Harris not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cory C.
The Court ordered no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marlon R Harris in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  OCCR Tape#15-046
Defendant advised that due to a lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 40 for a Pretrial Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
